MUSC 101.courseDesc: A large chorus that studies and performs music of many styles; performs each term. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 101.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 101.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 102.courseDesc: A select choir that performs advanced choral repertoire; performs frequently on and off campus. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 102.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 102.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 103.courseDesc: Naturally Sharp is a select group of singers, chosen by audition in the fall from the University Chorus. Naturally Sharp performs vocal jazz repertoire from the past hundred years with a three-piece backup band. Singers must also be able to do solos.
MUSC 103.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 103.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 104.courseDesc: All-College Choir is a non-auditioned, mixed voice ensemble that performs repertoire of various styles, genres and eras - including music of the classical tradition, jazz, spirituals, American musical theater, folk and pop.
MUSC 104.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 104.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 105.courseDesc: Performs a wide variety of music written for a large band; concerts given each term. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 105.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 105.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 106.courseDesc: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small guitar ensemble; concerts given at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 106.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 106.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 107.courseDesc: Offers rehearsal, study, and performance of jazz compositions for both large and small ensembles; concerts given on and off campus, sometimes with guest soloists. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 107.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 107.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 108.courseDesc: Jazztet is a subset of the larger Jazz Orchestra. Its size can vary based upon the availability of instrumentation and the desire of the director. Its purpose is to present jazz music in a small instrumentation format. Performances are typically part of the greater Jazz Orchestra concerts at the end of each term.
MUSC 108.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 108.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 109.courseDesc: This is a full orchestra that performs concert repertoire of various periods from the 18th century to the present day. Wind, brass, and percussionists must be in the concert band in order to participate.
MUSC 109.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 109.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 110.courseDesc: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small keyboard ensemble; concerts given at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 110.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 110.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 111.courseDesc: Various small ensembles performing a variety of music of many periods and styles. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 111.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 111.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 112.courseDesc: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small fusion ensemble. The Fusion Band gives concerts at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 112.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 112.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 113.courseDesc: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small percussion ensemble. The ensemble gives concerts at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 113.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 113.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 114.courseDesc: The Drexel University Mediterranean Ensemble is open to any student with an interest in performing traditional music from the Balkans, the Middle East and Northern Africa. All instruments are welcomed.
MUSC 114.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 114.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 115.courseDesc: Performs gospel music drawn from both traditional and contemporary sources. Performance opportunities for both singers and instrumentalists. Concerts given on and off campus each term. May be repeated for credit.
MUSC 115.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 115.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 116.courseDesc: Pep Band is a group of roughly forty-five student musicians primarily from the concert band. The purpose of the Pep Band is to support the Drexel Dragons basketball team and play from the bleachers at home games as well as travel to tournaments.
MUSC 116.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 116.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 117.courseDesc: Rock Ensemble is an ensemble where students have the opportunity to gain experience working as a group rehearsing, arranging, organizing, recording, and ultimately performing songs in the rock/pop/contemporary genres. By choosing music that is both of high quality and varied, students have a unique opportunity to develop a strong work ethic while being exposed to various musical challenges.
MUSC 117.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 117.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 118.courseDesc: MUSC 118forms its participants into various sized string groups from trios and quartets to octets. The repertoire spans music of the classical tradition and beyond, from the modern day back to the 17th century. These small groups will perform as part of a larger chamber recital at the end of each term.
MUSC 118.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 118.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 120.courseDesc: Music Fundamentals teaches students essential skills and knowledge relating to Western music. Focus is placed on ear training and core music theory concepts. This course perfectly compliments any student’s musical playing ability, beginning to advanced, and is essential to further musical development.
MUSC 120.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 121.courseDesc: MUSC 121covers the foundations of: notation, major/minor scales and keys, intervals, chord construction, phrase construction, small forms, and basic techniques of harmonizing a melody. The methodology centers on analysis combined with application.
MUSC 121.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 122.courseDesc: MUSC 122covers: texture and textural reduction, chromatic harmony, modulation, and large forms. This is a continuation ofMUSC 121and provides more depth into the topics of that course as well as offers advanced material. The methodology combines musical analysis with application.
MUSC 122.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 124.courseDesc: Jazz Theory introduces musical concepts and skills as they pertain to this specific style of music. The material discussed is foundational knowledge for jazz composition, arranging, and improvisation. Therefore, this course is suitable for students interested in jazz performance or composition.
MUSC 124.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 125.courseDesc: Introduces the basics of ear training and sight singing.
MUSC 125.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 126.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 130.courseDesc: Provides an introduction to music, including elements of melody, harmony, rhythm, texture, structure, history, and an introduction to various genres. Emphasizes listening with understanding.
MUSC 130.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 134.courseDesc: This course introduces the various Latin American musical traditions, as well as their historical contexts, evolution, inter-connectivity and current importance.
MUSC 134.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 152.courseDesc: This course will examine the art and craft of songwriting. Students will listen to and analyze many examples from folk and popular music, from the 1930’s through to the present day. Students will use this knowledge, as well as that of basic music fundamentals, to compose a song at the end of the term.
MUSC 152.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 190.courseDesc: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on piano.
MUSC 190.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 191.courseDesc: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on guitar.
MUSC 191.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 192.courseDesc: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on percussion.
MUSC 192.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 193.courseDesc: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction in voice.
MUSC 193.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 194.courseDesc: Class Bass I uses group instruction to teach basic performance skills and techniques on electric bass guitar and upright bass.
MUSC 194.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 194.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 6 credits

MUSC 195.courseDesc: Class Bass II uses group instruction to teach advanced performance skills and techniques on electric bass guitar and upright bass.
MUSC 195.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 195.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 6 credits

MUSC 196.courseDesc: Students will learn the fundamentals in jazz piano playing by studying the melodic, harmonic and rhythmic aspects associated with jazz. Students will learn how to read, “lead sheets” and improvise over modal and standard chord changes.
MUSC 196.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 229.courseDesc: Modern Arranging Techniques. Discusses the capabilities and ranges of varying instruments. Students study modern arranging techniques utilizing strategies and standard music material.
MUSC 229.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 231.courseDesc: This course surveys and analyzes compositions from antiquity through the modern period in European music history. After an overview of musical vocabulary, we will study selected masterpieces of Western music, thereby gaining a greater appreciation for developments of musical style.
MUSC 231.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 232.courseDesc: This course surveys and analyzes compositions from the Romantic Era through the 21st Century in European classical music history.
MUSC 232.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 234.courseDesc: This course will examine the cultural phenomena of The Beatles from their early history as a band through the end of their regular collaboration in 1970. While The Beatles have been examined in many different ways, this course will concentrate on their productivity as a rock band through the single pop song, the pop album, and film. It will also serve to provide a more in depth study of the group and their influence on other popular culture.
MUSC 234.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 235.courseDesc: This course surveys film music from the silent film era to the present. Topics will include the composers of the genre, the changing musical styles through the decades, and the techniques used by film composers.
MUSC 235.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 236.courseDesc: Surveys rock music from its roots through the mid-60s.
MUSC 236.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 238.courseDesc: Surveys rock music from the mid-60s through the mid-90s.
MUSC 238.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 241.courseDesc: Weekly private music lessons on an instrument or voice as indicated by the section number. Lessons are fifty minutes per week. The specific day and time is mutually agreed upon by the instructor and the student. Musical style, level of ability, and learning objectives are individually based. Students are encouraged to contact the instructor if they have questions. Students are charged a lab fee every term they register.
MUSC 241.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC 241.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC 249.courseDesc: Digital Music Composition teaches students how to compose music intended to be produced by a computer and related to software, opposed to composing for acoustic instruments. Students will learn how to use specific music software and explore contemporary compositional techniques.
MUSC 249.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 252.courseDesc: Music Composition engages students in writing music for ensembles ranging from solo performer to large ensemble. Techniques of the common practice period as well as modernist harmonic techniques will be introduced and applied. Live performance of student projects will be provided and is an important feature of the course.
MUSC 252.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 290.courseDesc: Class Piano II is a continuation of Class Piano I. By the end of the term students will be able to perform a number of simple songs, play several scales and chord progressions, and have basic note reading skills.
MUSC 290.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 291.courseDesc: Class Guitar II is a continuation of Class Guitar I. In this course students continue to work on note reading in first position, develop rhythmic skills and reading ability in different keys, learn movable barred chords and power chords, and learn basic finger picking technique.
MUSC 291.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 300.courseDesc: Provides study and practice of various improvisatory styles in music. Includes classroom lectures, listening, and solo and ensemble performance.
MUSC 300.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 323.courseDesc: Addresses basic songwriting techniques including form, melody, rhythm, lyrics, and production. Projects are required.
MUSC 323.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 331.courseDesc: Surveys various musical traditions from around the world in their cultural contexts. Includes selected music from Africa, the Americas, Europe, South Asia, Southeast Asia, Northeast Asia, West Asia, and Oceania.
MUSC 331.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 333.courseDesc: Examines the African heritage and related New World forms outside the United States. Covers work songs, spirituals, blues, folk music, ragtime, gospel, rhythm and blues, jazz, etc.
MUSC 333.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 334.fullName: The Power of Black American Music
MUSC 334.courseDesc: Provides an overview of American Folk music established by Black Americans in the early 1600s. Attention will be given to the African and Caribbean heritage exploring the religious, economic, cultural, and social environment that gave birth to work songs, spirituals, ragtime, blues, jazz, country, gospel, rock ‘n’ roll, rhythm & blues, soul, and hip hop. The course provides the opportunity to listen to music and highlight the musical inventions Black Americans brought to the new world.
MUSC 334.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 336.courseDesc: Surveys the music popularly known as jazz from before 1900 through the stylistic changes and trends of the 20th century. Covers precursors, early jazz, big bands, bebop, the new music, etc.
MUSC 336.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 337.courseDesc: Hip-Hop Music History is a comprehensive exploration of the origins of hip-hop music, and its meteoric rise to a preeminent genre of popular American music today. Instruction for this course comprises of the examination of hip-hop's noteworthy practitioners, the corroborative technology and propitious media which support it, and the often innovative practice of musical and lyrical creativity that defines the genre.
MUSC 337.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 338.courseDesc: Examines popular music (dances, marches, ragtime, jazz, musical comedy, movie music, swing, rock, etc.) from Colonial times to the present, with cultural-historical contexts.
MUSC 338.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC 342.courseDesc: Students will present a public recital featuring significant solo repertoire. Repertoire choices for recital must be made through the Applied Music instructor.
MUSC 342.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MUSC I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MUSC I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MUSC I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MUSC I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MUSC I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MUSC T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MUSC T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC T380.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MUSC T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MUSC T480.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MUSC T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MUSC T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
